Y lucio gobir.

"Time, doctor Freeman?........ Is it really that time again?" 

Wow. This moment at the end caused goosebumps up and down my body. I was absolutely floored. I think it's important to say for the context of this review that this is my first time playing the Half Life series. I have never played HL1 or any of the other expansions so I don't know G-Man at all.. I know of him, but nothing more than knowing his name and face.

There was something special about this moment at the end. Nothing else in modern gaming has captured it for me. 

From a first timer to the Half Life series in 2021, I have to say that HL2 is a must own. Honestly, it should be required gaming for any gamer out there. Each chapter is unique. The physics and gameplay are still top notch and hold up today. I love the horror elements too. I was not expecting that xenomorph looking thing to scream like it did while leaping at you. Oh and the music.. Oh wow the music. When you first put on that suit and that music hits ('Hazardous Enviorments') or when you hear that song 'Triage at Dawn' after Winston is hit... I don't even know Winston but I felt the world for him after hearing that music play. Both great tracks, overall the game has an amazing OST.

Anybody that has Steam installed also needs HL2 installed. 10/10

God, this game made me so motion sick and reminded me why I don't play first person games. 

Anyway. I finally played it and expected a life changing experience after all the hype. And I'm a little disappointed. Not only because the game made me throw up like 5 times. 

But seriously. Overhype can kill a game. My expectations were so high that anything that didn't fundamentaly change my life wouldn't meet them. 

That said, this game is pretty good. Not the best thing I've ever played, but pretty good. And it still mostly holds up. I think that the story and the world are the best parts. The gameplay wasn't my cup of tea, I'm not realy into FPS games. But I finished it anyway. And that says a lot. 

Overall, for someone who doesn't usually play first person shooters and didn't play this game when it came out, I give it a 7/10. It would get 8/10 if I could pet Dog.
